Scope of Project   The project will focus on implementing AWS cloud-based infrastructure for SSA’s satellite data management needs. The primary components include: Computational Power: Amazon EC2 instances for data processing. Storage: Amazon S3 for storing raw and processed satellite data. Release 1: Deployment of infrastructure, installation of Open Data Cube, and provisioning of the following datasets: Sentinel-2, Sentinel-3, Landsat 7, Landsat 8, and Landsat 9. Release 1: Deployment of infrastructure, installation of Open Data Cube, and indexing of datasets for the Proof of Concept (POC) use case. This phase will focus on a limited geographic region and a specific application to validate system functionality. The following datasets will be provisioned: Sentinel-2, Sentinel-3, Landsat 7, Landsat 8, and Landsat 9. Release 2: Expansion to a fully functional use case, scaling dataset coverage beyond the initial POC region. This phase will refine data indexing, enhance processing capabilities, and incorporate additional datasets and analytical tools based on stakeholder needs.

The project focuses on implementing AWS cloud-based infrastructure for managing SSA's satellite data. It includes provisions for computational power using Amazon EC2 instances, storage utilizing Amazon S3, and specific dataset deployment for various satellite sources like Sentinel-2, Sentinel-3, Landsat 7, Landsat 8, and Landsat 9. The project is divided into Release 1 and Release 2. Release 1 involves deploying infrastructure, setting up Open Data Cube, and provisioning datasets for a Proof of Concept (POC) covering limited geographic regions and specific applications. Release 2 expands the project to a fully functional use case by scaling dataset coverage, refining data indexing, enhancing processing capabilities, and incorporating additional datasets and tools as per stakeholder requirements.
